38844160.review:
Fun game of tower defense, although not the most innovative. It has some neat extras, such as unlockable traps, and a trap levelling progression. Beat previous levels with added difficulty and gain more experience, which makes future levels easier. All that said, this is truly a TOWER DEFENSE GAME with all the feel of placing towers and zapping the horde of marching toward the door. Don't expect the game play to go much farther than the original gameplay. In fact, it feels like less than the original, because most of the equipment is unlocked through grinding levels. Many hours are spent with the same scant few towers being used over and over, while you try to beat more advanced levels for typical equipment. Yet, for the low cost, there is plenty to like here, and I have spent many hours working out better strategies for the levels, but I also wish it was delivering more of the later game play a bit sooner.

I have always had a mischevious spot for dungeon traps, and I had this crazy book in my RPG days filled with all sorts of clever traps for killing characters. This game scratches that itch to a degree, but I kind of wish it hit the mark with a bit more oomph. I think the designers should have realized that there was a lot more fun pushing a mob down a bottomless pit than shooting it a million times with an arrow trap. Ah well!

38721071.review:
I'm a big tower defense fan and this is a very solid tower defense game. Certainly near the top of all the ones I've played. Probably the best 2D one.

I'd say if you like tower defense games then it's arguably worth the full $10 price. On sale it is 100% worth it.

+There is a good variety of towers/ traps. 
+There is a fairly large selection of maps (most of the map is shown in one of the screenshots), which can be made bigger with workshop/ mod maps.
+Almost no flyers (-they add flying enemies on the last two maps >_>)
+Every map has an endless mode.
+Unlocking endless requires being a level with 6 difficulty modifers so it encourages repeat plays.
+Difficulty modifiers for increased XP and variation of play.
+There is a modifier which decreases difficulty so for those who want to just have some fun or for if a level is proving particularly difficult you won't get locked behind a level to progress. You can always go back later and replay any level with more upgrades/ unlocks.

Some design choices that make me appreciate this game more than most.
+Calling waves early gives 50 gold bonus regardless of time so doesn't push you hit next wave as soon as it appears every time for maximum bonus.
+There is no mechanic that leads you to hoard gold. You get it you spend it.
+The upgrade system doesn't tie you down into using specific towers. It's more tied to progression and XP where you can change around your tower upgrades every map.

---There are flying enemies in the game.
-8 difficulty modifiers is a decent selection but more would certianly be nice.
-The way endless mode is set up many of the towers become entirely useless to have in your loadout.
-Some of the towers quickly feel inferior to towers you get later in the game, especially on later levels. As soon as I got what is essentially the heavier version of the basic arrow tower I think I only ever took it once after that which was problably before I hit even the half way point of levels unlocked which doesn't incluse any level replays/ endless

38585719.review:
Honestly one of the best defense games I've ever played. You basically are tasked with setting up a dungeon to defend your portal against an incoming horde of 'heroes' and dungeon delvers. You set up traps, minions, an use the dungeon layout to your advantage in order to defeat the waves of enemies coming your way. 

What I find most interesting is that you can defeat the different dungeons in multiple ways depending on what traps and tools you have at your disposal. It's sort of a puzzle game in this way, as you need to figure out the best possible way you can figure out how to defend against each new challenge.

Highly recommended, and this coming from someone who doesn't generally go into Tower Defense / Dungeon set up type games.

虽然游戏有点时间了，不过确实是一款不错的塔防游戏，到后期不会是很单一的组合，而且还有中文~

游戏内容不累述了，说几个心得。
1.地图适合，灵魂收割者一定上，刷刷钱还是很有提升的
2.闪电打飞行器效果显著，3个3J的闪电（彼此之间只要不是连在一起,空一格摆一个就可以了），基本上就可以守住一条路（没有别的怪干扰）

38402131.review:
The best tower defense game I played. It feels like a very fun sandbox to play in: it has a 2d physics that can be hilarious, the traps and defenses are interesting and often have a powerful feel to them - using is satisfying. Somehow that physics engine makes those dungeon feel more alive, when it get's very crowded and massive amounts of enemies are pushed over the edge, it's awesome.

While it's very fun, it also feels well balanced and upgrades are well done. Using various "mutators" to reply the levels with added difficulties opens whole new field to replying old levels (for example, you can add one that gives you just one health instead of 20, or adds health/regeneration to enemies, etc - those will give you experience multipliers, so adding more can make it crazy hard but also give insane exp). So you can develope interesting combinations/strategies for earning extra experience needed to boost your defenses even more. 

Also, various consumables (traps you put on certain spots "on the fly", and wait for the timer to reset so you can place some more) make it more dynamic, and adds yet another layer to possible strategies, as you can choose only one type of consumable for a given battle.

But honestly, just see this game on youtube if you are not sold already. If it looks awesome to you, well it plays very awesome too!

37927210.review:
始めに言っておく。これはハマる。
まだクリアしてないのに、たまらずレビューを書いてしまう程に。

XENO TACTICとKINGDOM RUSHをアホほどやり込んだ立場で言わせていただくと、
非常によく出来ている。それらと並び（俺の中の）三大TDと言ってもいい。

画面は真上からの俯瞰型で、雰囲気は暗め。
敵を倒すと血肉が飛び散り、穴に落とすと悲鳴を上げる。

結構な種類のトラップがあり、設置場所は壁か床ならどこでも可。
それらをステージ、敵の特徴に合わせて運用してギリギリ守りきった時の緊張感と達成感は、
思わず拳を握ってしまうほど。防衛中はそんな暇無いので、終わったら存分に握ろう。
逆に余裕だった時は雰囲気や設定も相まって「フッ、カスどもが！」と魔王の気分になる。どっちも愉快。

ステージをクリアすると経験値とジェムが手に入る。
経験値では初期資金ブーストと追加ジェムを得られ、ジェムは罠の強化などに使う。
なお、取得経験値は各ステージクリア時の（その時のスコア－それまでのスコア）となる。
何度でも挑戦出来るので、頑張って、より高いスコアを出し、拳を握りましょう。

そして最大の特徴は、わかりやすく細かいセルフ難易度設定。
敵のHP増加・速度上昇などがあり、内容に応じて経験値倍率が上がる。
思いの外難しくても安心、難易度を下げることも出来る。
すごいと思ったのは「罠が３種類しか使えない縛り」を有効にしても、
基礎レベルを上げてしっかり戦略を練ればちゃんとクリア出来るところ。
開発時の調整作業、ハンパなかったと思う。熱意と完成度に頭が垂れる。そして拳を握る。

鼻息荒く長々と書いてしまったが、TD好きならぜひやってほしい。
「タワーディフェンスってなぁに？」という人にもやってほしい。
TDが嫌いな人は普通に他のゲームで拳を握ってほしい。おわり。

37746811.review:
タワーディフェンスというジャンルは正直あまり好きではなかったが、それはこのゲームをプレイするまで。
一本の道があり、敵がそこを通り、道沿いに兵器を置いて迎撃する、という古めかしいTDのイメージはすぐに崩れ去り、
動線をコントロールし、敵にそこを通らせ、殺人トラップでブチブチと殺しまくる快感がそこにあった。

ぶっ飛んだ能力や特定の設備の設置を強要するような嫌らしい敵はほとんどおらず、
ぼくのかんがえたさいきょうのだんじょんでゴリゴリ進んでいけて楽しい。

敵の強化や自分への縛りを行って難易度と経験値倍率を調整する仕組みがあり、
ギリギリでクリアできる倍率を探って経験値を稼ぐも良し、
難易度を上げずに気持ちよく進むも良し、と自分に合うように難しさ調節できるので万人におすすめできる。

最後に一点、使い方がなかなか分からなかったものがあったのでネタバレにならないように教えておきます。
｢六芒星が浮かび上がったらクリックで発射｣

36411021.review:
Dungeon Warfare is an extremely good TD game. I enjoyed this game a great deal, and honestly I was very surprised how much I played. I got a large majority of the Achievements via just playing the game. Then towards the end I challenged myself to obtain more of the achievements and it didn't take long. 

Pro's:
Tons of unique towers (All of which you most likely will use)
Plenty of great levels 
Unique "mobs" 
A great leveling system.
The speed feels just right, if you want to play faster you can, but unlike some TD the game is has an amazing speed vs. play. Just the right amount of time to make a decision, or to pause temporarily to think for a quick second. 
Plenty of play ability.
and most importantly every map can be solved in a unique way, or utilizing many & I mean many different tower combinations. 
For "Legit" Achievement hunters its a great game you'll obtain most of the achievement while playing. If you "beat" the game most likely you'll be able to obtain most of the achievements without having to spend too much time doing so. 
Majority of my play time was just playing the game, I think I spend an additional 2 hours trying to obtain some of the achievements I didn't obtain before "beating/finishing" the last level or "hidden level". (p.s. I call the hidden level the last level because that level gave me the most difficulty
And on a last note the game didn't feel tedious, I'm not sure about the rest of you but some TD games feel tedious to me.

Cons: 
No story

Neutral:
No heroes

36405719.review:
TDゲーム。
プレイヤーはダンジョンの支配者となり侵入してくる人間を罠で撃退していくオーソドックスなTDだ。ステージクリアすると経験値が入りレベルが上がれば初期金などが増え、手に入るジェムで罠を強化することができる。また、敵の強さに変化を加えるルーンを有効することにより、難しくまたは簡単に難易度を変化させることができる。

[難易度バランス]
上手く調整されたバランスだと思う。終盤こそ難易度は高めに思えるステージはあるがゲームを理解すればクリアできるようになっている。どうしてもクリアできない場合は難易度を下げるルーンを有効にするか、レベリングで強化するかの他に[spoiler]強化した氷結爆弾でハメる[/spoiler]という手段もある。

[罠]
罠の種類は豊富で敵を吹っ飛ばすような罠が多いので、罠の組み合わせを考える楽しみがある。ブラックホールで敵を引き戻して再度スプリングの床を歩かせるとか、スライム床とダートトラップで敵を足止めするとか、足止めが難しい素早い大量の敵をライトニングトラップを経路上に乱立させて数を減らすとか様々な方法を試すことができる。特にバリケードなどは経路コントロールに使用出来る他に敵の上に落として敵を即死させるできるので重要だ。

[エディタ]
エディタがあり自分でステージを作ることができる。シンプルで分かりやすいので簡単にステージを作ることができるが、TDであるが故に敵の出現数のバランス調整は難しい。

難易度バランスが良く完成度の高いTDだと思う。大量の敵を罠で殲滅していく内容と敵が死ぬときの悲鳴、プレイヤーがダンジョンの支配者という設定で、少し嗜虐的なテイストがある爽快感があるのも良い。強いて悪いところを挙げるとすればUI表示が大きくて罠のアップグレードメニューなどが見づらかったりすることで、UIの大きさ調整機能があれば良かった。
TDが好きならオススメのゲームだ。

35725429.review:
This is how indie game should be

Dungeon Warfare is a classic Tower Defense game with 1 small differences. Instead of towers you have traps, a lot of traps, actually. The rules are simple, enemies are approaching, place traps to destroy them. Get gold by killing them and place new traps. Repeat until a level is finished. When you get lvl up and upgrade your traps or get new ones. When new level starts. As i said, it's classic.

There were the things I really liked. For example, its really pleasant to see how enemies die :D
Nice visual and sound effects. Also, there are a lot of enemies comes, they gather in group and then a group dies... its awesome feeling. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1166526091

There is a lot of everything. There are ground traps, wall traps, hook trap, demon portal which summons units on the path, push trap and etc... so you have unlimited choice of ways to pass every level. You received the experience by passing levels and then you get gems which can be spent on upgrades of towers. It's sad, but they gives small bonuses like -1% cooldown time, but there are a lot of them. I know, some people like systems like this. Also, these upgrades unlocks new upgrade for traps. For example, if you will make 15 upgrade for Spike Trap, it will get 3 upgrades +1 damage /+1 damage and 2 upgrades fro choose, add burning effect on attack twice per activation.

There is interesting mechanic for setting difficulty. There are 12 tunes in the game, each rune add an feature to the game (enemies get extra health or you have got only 1 live and etc.). If you take rune to the battle, the game becomes harder, but you will receive increased reward, up to 7 times of basic. So, you can change the difficulty of the game whatever you want with such interesting mechanic.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1166764502

There are also things which I could describe as boring. First of all, the bestiary of enemies is small. I have passed about 15 levels and have met only 7-8 different enemies. There comes an another flow, the design of waves of levels. They are... the same... A bunch of peasants with nobles comes at the first waves. Fast moving thieves com at the 2 or second wave. Then knights with moderate HP and armor appear. At the last wave a lot of Crusaders com, they have large amount of health and heavy armor. So, I after I realized it after ~12 mission, the game become pretty boring for me. Yeah, new traps, units, runes appear... I am an old TD fan, but it wasn't enough for me. 

Also, this game lacks of strategy. There is no special strategy for different enemies. All traps are good against all enemies. So it's possible to pass the mission without any thinking. I don't think it's a good feature for a strategy game.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1166526149

[h1]Resume[/h1]
This game will be interesting for TD fans. People who like sandboxes and games with not strict goals and ways of their achievement will find this game satisfying. But this freedom brings a lack of diversity between missions. Anyway, the game is worth for a try. I recommend it

İlk önce Armor Games'de yayınlanmış, ardından geliştirilerek Greenlight aracılığıyla Steam'e eklenmiş, biraz vahşi biraz sevimli bir tower defence oyunudur kendisi. 

[h1]Sevdiğim yönlerini şöyle sıralamak istiyorum:[/h1]

+ Çok sayıda tuzak olması ve bunların hepsinin aynı destede kullanılamıyor olması. Her bölümde aynı strateji işlemiyor, bu durum oyunu canlı tutuyor. 
+ Tuzak ve düşman tasarımları keyif verici şeyler. Zindana "atla" giren düşman var mesela, favorim... 
+ "Tecrübe" sistemi olması. Bölümleri bitirdikçe level atlayarak elinizdeki tuzakları güçlendirme imkanınız oluyor.
+ Bölümlere başlarken o bölümde avantaj ya da dezavantaj sağlayabilecek seçenekleri kullanabiliyorsunuz. Gelenler daha hızlı gelsin, güçleri daha az gitsin, zırhları daha fazla olsun gibi şeyler. Bunlar o bölümün sonunda alacağınız tecrübe puanını etkiliyor.
+ Ana bölümleri, kurması çok zor olmayan stratejilerle bitirmek mümkün. Ancak bu ana bölümlerden sonra açılan yan bölümler kolay lokma değil. Yani hem casual sevenlere hem hardcore sevenlere yanıt vermeye çalışmışlar oyunda.
+ "Kötülük" draması yapmak isteyen kişiyi memnun edecek bir yaklaşımı var. Gelenleri öldürdükçe "juicy" diye sesler geliyor oyundan. Zincirleme katliam yapabiliyorsunuz. Duvardaki dikenin, çukurdaki lavın üzerine düşman itebiliyor, altın dolu vagonların geçtiği rayların üzerinde aylak aylak yürüyen karakterlerin vagon çarpmasıyla uçurumdan aşağıya bağırarak düşüşünü zevkle izleyebiliyorsunuz. Düşmanın üzerine barikat kurup onu ezebiliyorsunuz falan.
+ Az yer kaplıyor, kasmıyor, optimizasyonu güzel, görüntü akıcı.
+ Map editor sayesinde kendi haritalarınızı tasarlayabiliyorsunuz.

[h1]Sonuç:[/h1]

Tower defence, strateji, pixel art, zindan teması sevenler indirimde şans verebilir :)

35282330.review:
Dungeon Warfare is a fantastic tower defense game that offers uniqueness in the genre and plenty of replay value. As of writing the review, I have unlocked all levels and have beaten the game. It took me approximately forty hours to do so. The value here is immense; going by the $1.00 per hour of gameplay rule, you can expect to get four times or more of your money's worth, considering you buy it for full price.

This game is somewhat reminiscent of Dungeon Keeper. Your goal is to prevent the good guys from reaching your dungeon portal, and you must use various traps at your disposal (along with rechargeable spells, of which there are many that you may unlock over the course of the game). Keeping true to the genre, strategy is key, for particular traps are more useful in some areas than others. Unlike many tower defense games, many traps are able to be placed on the ground rather than on "towers" or walls, such as spikes/slime/grinders, which varies things up quite a bit. Throughout the game, winning one level will unlock up to three more, and each level shows you its layout and what it unlocks upon completion before you even play it. There are over forty levels in the main game, some of which are required to progress, and some of which are optional and grant you gems (required to level up everything; they upgrade your traps, spells, and even how much gold/lives you start out with). Beating a level also unlocks the ability to replay it with runes, reminiscent of the Gemcraft series. Each rune offers a different challenge, such as additional enemy health/speed, and enabling a rune on a level and subsequently beating it offers you an XP multiplier, which helps you level up. Thus, if you ever get stuck on a level, there are multiple options at your disposal to allow you to earn XP to level with and try again.

I am past level 70, and there is no end in sight. Do not expect reachable level caps here. Even once all trap upgrade tiers are unlocked (they can upgrade to level four, granting additional benefits and abilities during the level) you can continue to upgrade them to cost less, trigger more often, etc. You could, technically, play this game forever, and keep upgrading your already powerful traps to become ridiculous.

Levels are varied and interesting, and even the environments change (from excavation/mining areas to tombs to ice levels). There is a level editor to create even more levels, as if the abundance here isn't already more of an offering than most games in the genre. The graphics are endearing and colorful, and the game does not shy away from pixelated gore, a DOS-era voice chiming in after a killstreak to comment, "Juicy!" The music here is fantastic. There is an Easter egg of sorts to be found by those of us who are fans of the tower defense genre in later levels, and there is a secret level to be found within the game. I encourage you to find it yourself; if you beat the game without finding it, the ending credits will tell you which level to go back to in order to search for it.

I haven't had this much fun with a tower defense game since Kingdom Rush Frontiers. I spent 40 hours in this game over the course of a week, and I didn't get bored. This will be a game I will revisit in the future, and I highly recommend it to tower defense and strategy fans. Upon beating it I immediately searched for more Valsar games to support, and was disappointed to find none. If the developer releases more games in the future, I will be supporting them for sure.

Generic review junk out of the way, it's fun, it looks great and it's tower defense done right.

[b]It's as hard as you make it and that's how you do a good Tower Defense game[/b]
The game uses an XP system to unlock gems which determine the cooldown and discount of your weaponry, aswell unlock tier upgrades. What makes this system great is that gem upgrades [b]ARE NOT PERMANENT and can be re-downgraded[/b]. This mean you can strategize your upgrades when playing certain maps.

 The XP system rewards those that play with higher diffiiculties via the rune system. If the game is too easy you can use runes that do things such as "raise enemy hp, spawn rate, weight and so forth".  In turn this boosts your XP multiplier and rewards you for challenging yourself.

34161339.review:
After 150 hours spent in the game I feel it's about time I write a review.

Oh boy, this game was a blast to play. As far as Tower Defense games go I feel it has a reasonable level of difficulty, though some levels – such as Shallow Grave or The Mountain – can be pretty brutal if you're unprepared.

Every trap can serve you well in defending your dungeons, even the humble Dart Trap and Spike Trap you start the game with. By leveling up and using the gems obtained to upgrade your traps, you increase their efficiency – more damage, faster cooldowns, or lower cost. Mixing and matching your loadouts and set up was half of the fun for me in Dungeon Warfare. The other half admittedly came from playing with physics traps like the Push Trap and Spring Trap, knocking hapless heroes into the abyss or pools of liquid and hearing them shout in dismay before disappearing.

The game gives you plenty of flexibility in how you approach a level. There'll be pits you can try tossing enemies into, or using Spring/Push traps to launch enemies into spiked walls for an instant kill, and with the varied traps all being fairly balanced and useful, the combinations of traps and upgrades brings quite a bit of variety into how you play. Sometimes replaying the same map under a different loadout can be quite fun.

After you've cleared enough levels, you can start using Runes to increase the difficulty, as well as increasing your rewards. This can be a good method of leveling up to be better prepared for later maps like The Mountain.  

Eventually you'll want to take a look at the included Map Editor. It's fairly straightforward and easy to grasp, and making your own maps or downloading those made by others further adds to what you can do during your time playing. Making maps of my own and trying to beat them has been a lot of fun as well.

The music is also fairly nice, especially the opening theme that also sometimes plays during your time defending your dungeons.


All in all, I really enjoyed Dungeon Warfare, and its sequel that's on the horizon is looking like it'll be quite amazing.

34000889.review:
A fantastic tower defense, with captivating pixel art and a plethora of unique traps.  Use the hex trap and turn single enemies into frogs, or use the bolt trap that does a lot more damage to the larger enemies.  Use a grappling hook trap to pull enemies down a pit or into lava, or use a lot of flame traps to stack burn on enemies and wipe out large crowds.  The game also has consumables, which are essentially spells which do different things.  Place an egg on the ground, that when cracked spawns a minion to attack creeps, or use the midas consumable to turn enemies into gold, stunning them and making them give more gold on death.


The games upgrades are also interesting.  Consumables can be upgraded to gain new effects on use, towers gain cooldown reduction, damage, or many other things.  The final tier of each trap offers a completely unique upgrade to each trap, and that fully upgraded trap can only be used once on the level.  The final level of the slow trap makes the slow trap deal 1 damage per second, which can be used in a chokepoint to conquer levels with ease.  These unique consumables, upgrades and large amount of various traps allow you to play however you essentially want.  

The game features workshop support (not many levels are actually on the workshop, sadly), runes for each level (make levels harder and get more exp), and a survival gamemode which works on any level.  Last for as long as you can with increasing difficulty, but your limit on max level traps is increased, so more strategies are opened.  




Buy Dungeon Warfare if you are a veteran of tower defenses, or a newcomer to the genre and looking to find a fantastic game.

先玩的手机版，然后补的票~
我个人比较喜欢塔防游戏。
但是现在大部分塔防都相当恶心，要么怪只能按照默认的路走，要么整个地图都是空的(顶多弄几个障碍物)。
当然这两种之中也存在精品，比如说Kingdom Rush系列

玩完KR之后，我曾经以为我不会看上其他塔防游戏了
直到我遇到DW、宝石争霸、Tiny Guardian、宝石TD(这不挺多优秀的塔防吗。。。)
----------------我是分割线o>_<o---------------
说说优点
+半开放的怪物进攻路线，可以设置路障改变线路，但是路障可被摧毁
+类似宝石争霸的符文系统，可以增加难度(虽然这样我也不会考虑再打一遍233)
++地形杀，这个相当有创意，消灭敌人的方法不只有打死一种
+无尽模式，虽然这个很常见但是还是可以增加可玩度
++自定义地图！
+有隐藏关好评，进入隐藏关的方法显而易见但实行起来有一定难度

然后一些说不上优点或缺点的“特点”
有积累经验的等级系统，升级陷阱的宝石主要依靠升级得来，后期重新挑战前面关卡会过于简单(虽然用了符文)
每种4级陷阱只能建一个(无尽模式可以随时间增加可建数量)

当然还有缺点
-敌人种类虽多但特点不突出，敌人的特技并不能很大影响玩家的策略(和KR相比)。反正在我看来只有跑的快的和跑得慢的敌人233(当然“骑兵”这个敌人是最特别的也是最恶心的，不得不说这个敌人设计得很好)
-虽说有路障这种建筑提高自由度，但玩家主要还是在思考“我怎么放墙可以把所有敌人聚在一起”而不是考虑“如何让敌人在路上受到更多伤害”，虽然这两个并不矛盾
--召唤类的建筑太垃圾了，我召唤的恶魔为什么会受到我的陷阱的伤害啊。。。虽然这样是科学一点但是召唤陷阱到底有什么用。。。远不如KR的兵营那么有趣

33729826.review:
Dungeon Warfare is an excellent 2D Tower Defense game.  If you want something that's light on plot, but heavy on gameplay, check it out.

The gameplay is a bit like a top-down Orcs Must Die, with very similar traps and music, but is in no way a knockoff.

The game isn't nearly as difficult as I was expecting, with only one of the last levels giving me a bit of trouble getting a perfect score on.  This isn't so much a con as you can enable runes at the start of each level that buff the enemies or otherwise give you a bit of a disadvantage in exchange for greater EXP and unlocking that particular levels Endless mode upon completion.

My biggest complaints would have to be that there are far too few bosses, and the flying enemies are introduced only during the last couple stages, and as such don't feel utililized nearly enough.

Overall an excellent TD, highly reccomended, and I am looking forward to getting my hands on the recently announced sequel.

33015346.review:
This game is a masterpiece hidden among the huge piles of trash greenlighted by the steam community. This game provides a unique tower defence type gameplay, that really has a lot of content. Each single level can be played many different ways, and the runes feature means you can adjust difficulty, whether it being having only 1 life, or having limited upgrades. These runes also give xp bonuses when you have them equipped, rewarding you for playing a harder mode. The endless mode is enough to keep any one occupied for hours on a single map. The game is also constantly updated, and the developers interact with the community, so yoru voice is always heard. I would definitely give this game a 10/10. and i expect large updates and new maps to come.

(Plus the steam workshop compatibility is AMAZING!)

32866189.review:
这是个自由度和可重玩性很高的TD，每种陷阱的差异很大而且还算平衡，各种地图各种build都可以成立，甚至你可以自定义你的敌人——用一些叫做‘神符’的东西给敌人加各种buff，增加关卡的难度并且谋求更多的回报。

但是问题也在这：因为玩家的升级要素、陷阱和能力都是逐步解锁的，神符也是逐步解锁的（而且升级要素解锁的十分缓慢），导致即使你绞尽脑汁完成了一个（当前看来）极限全神符击破——等再过3、5关回来再看之前的努力啥都不是。

——dev用这种方法强迫你至少需要重玩三分之一的关卡来得到一个最终成就（所有关卡开6神符击破），即使你之前绞尽脑汁通掉了这些关卡，你也必须重新来一次，让你之前的努力白费掉。

更加糟糕的是，如果你选择一开始咸鱼混关，后半部分和二周目再咸鱼6神符的话，你会发现大部分关卡都特别简单，以至于你会怀疑自己是根本就一条咸鱼。

所以我想把这个游戏推荐给已经是咸鱼和不想做咸鱼的你们。

加油。

31840467.review:
这是我目前玩的最多的一款独立游戏，关于游戏推荐测评方面大家都说了，我说说平衡性的问题吧。
游戏的平衡性做的并不怎么好，特别对于地图设计来说。游戏中能够进攻路障的只有矮人，而游戏陷阱的升级又可以返还宝石。这就导致了玩家总是可以在前期集中升级几项实用的陷阱，然后在某些狭长绕圈的地图上使用路障和金币陷阱快速刷钱涨经验。特别是某些符文几乎无副作用的加经验（比如说一次性陷阱+10秒和基地生命值为1），让玩家们在游戏中期就能横扫地图无脑通关。在我90级挂着一堆负面符文面对最终BOSS的时候，我发现它居然连我第一个路障口都没有通过就被陷阱直接打光了生命值，再一次进行游戏才发现提示让我使用地形来对付他。
除了地图设计以外，游戏在一次性陷阱和符文方面也存在平衡性问题。如前文所说，我从头到尾一直挂着基地生命值为1和一次性陷阱+10秒的符文稳定赚经验居然少有失败，偶尔遇上的卡关基本都是多路口出兵，这时候带上升级过的路障规划下小兵路线就又可以开着双倍速度无脑通关。至于一次性陷阱，初期我带着各种陷阱均有过尝试，后来发现一次性陷阱带来的收益比不上多放两个四级陷阱来的实在无脑，就统一只带捕鼠夹来防止骑兵冲家了。在无限模式这种情况变好了一些，因为50波以后小兵的血量变多（超级厚）控制型的一次性陷阱作用就开始发挥作用了。
另外敌人配置方面也比较单一，特别是无穷模式之下后期的敌军配置，清一色的重型敌人兵让玩家除了地图杀以外毫无办法。
除此之外游戏的游玩体验堪称绝佳，而且游戏支持自定义地图，很多平时不怎么用的陷阱在玩家们脑洞大开的地图上都能给人完全不一样的体验，这绝对是物超所值的好游戏。

Been looking for a TD to "scratch that itch" after recovering from GemCraft addiction. I've tried dozens and have been left flat... I was beginning to think that GemCraft ruined me for all other TD games. However, this one is doing the trick so far. 

I've seen others try to deduce the formula as to what makes these games enjoyable/addicting, and have never really agreed with anyone so far. If I'm going to attempt the same, I would have to say it's the forced variation of defense (you really can't rely on one trap type) combined with the RPG like progression (runes unlock varied experiences on old maps, bringing you back for more and more). To some, this is considered "grindy", but you can only earn XP that surpasses your prior XP, preventing a stale sludging through old territory. 

The metal soundtrack is a bit repetitive, yet fitting, and the narration of kill streak approval is a pleasing nostalgia harkening back to early 90s Mortal Combat binges in the arcade.... "Juicy" 

All in all, this is the most satisfying TD I've played in nearly a year. Props to the devs.

A very good Tower Defense game. The graphics are made of a humble retro style, but mechanics is wonderfull. Appears to be a little game, but isn´t. A mixed system of experience, gems and gold coins grants upgrades for 20 kind of defenses, 8 rechargable items and 2 general enhances; every tower can upgrade until 4 times.There are 20 kind of foes and 2 bosses.towers, runes and items must be unblocked progressing in campaign, it has 50 maps, plus a secret one, and more can be made in the map editor.

31180417.review:
This is a MUST play for tower defense fans. Well worth the 10 dollars I spent on it. 

It is an incredibly well made game (apparently just 2 devs, so a good indie project to support), lots of variety, sufficient and charming pixel-graphics, good sounds, a neat physics engine, just all around very solid. I think the worst "bug" I found was a misspelling. 

Steam achievements are reasonable - no ridiculous grindy achieves, and only one is truly very difficult IMO (6 rune "The Mountain" eesh).

It starts out easy but quickly ramps up to varying levels of challenge. Lots of maps, with some being easy with obvious win-strats, but also some very good challenges and not-so-obvious strats. It's clear that most maps have multiple ways to complete them - this is a huge plus IMO. Nonetheless you quickly find that your go-to strat on the last couple maps no longer works on the next map - I had to adapt constantly.

Can't say enough good stuff about this game, definitely a 9 or 9.5 out of 10. Only complaints would be that some of the traps seemed underpowered (and even here, I probably just didn't figure out the best way to leverage them), and one trap was given too late. Could've used a few more achievements that were map+rune specific, but that's more of a suggestion than a complaint.

Buy this if you like TD!!

30523257.review:
TL-DR: If you like Tower Defense games, get this, it is one of the best out there. Way more towers than most games, lots of levels, good difficulty level, great game. 

I think this might be the best Tower Defense game I've played. I played a lot starting with Warcraft 3 mods, and then Desktop Tower Defense the flash game. Since then I've played dozens of TD games, on iPhone, Android, and PC. They all have pros and cons, PVZ is unique and fun but not all that interesting or deep, Gemcraft is the same and also grindy, Defence Grid is great and has really nice graphics but the game maybe lacks a little of something, Bloonz is great but a bit repetitive, Creeper World is smart yet shallow and quite sedate, etc..etc.. I could easily list 20 more.

But there is something about this game that just ticks all the right boxes. It is challenging without being a pain in the ass, you sometimes have to do a level a few times until you can finally nail it, but it is always doable without relying on luck or something. Also some games don't let you shape your path which annoys me, this game has plenty of path shaping so you get to pick different routes through the map. There are actually at least several ways to win each map, not just with the paths you make the creeps take, but with tower selection too. There are a LOT of towers in this game, unlike the lame TD games that only give you several, this one has something like 20 ish towers, each one with a unique effect, and each one upgradeable which sometimes gives an extra effect too. The maps are also made so that you use the environment a lot, there are bottomless pits, pools of lava, spikes on the wall, etc. You can sometimes ignore all of that and just win using towers, but sometimes you really need to use traps that fling enemies off the ledge into a pit or slam them into the spikes. There are also railroads running through many of the maps and you can again ignore these if you want, but it is a lot more efficient to make the creeps run along the path of the railway and get injured or killed by the mine carts that race along them. 

The graphics are retro pixelly style but they look nice enough to be able to make out what everything is clearly, and everything has its own style and feel, each creep type works in a unique way and looks unique, the towers are easy to spot by looking at them etc. The game is also very satisfying when killing stuff. Creeps don't just die like some TD games, in this game they die violently based on what killed them, so if you throw them into a pit they shout AAAAAAAAAAHH!! If you smack them into spikes they will splat with a cloud of blood. If you electrocute them they ZAP! with a satisfying sizzle. In a game that is all about carnage, I think this is important, and the devs did a good job of it.

Also there is some longevity with the gameplay as well, each map has modifiers so you can play in normal mode which is fine for below average players. They might have to replay some missions while they are figuring the game out, but mostly I think they will win each map first time. But if you click the Blood modifier for example, it means you have only 1 life. I can win each map with that enabled and it gives more XP for each map. And there are many more that increase that further but make it much harder. And there are even ones that lower the health of the creeps to make it easier. So you can easily tweak the game to be a bit easier or harder depending on how good you are at the game. Overall I think this only changes the amount of grind in the game. If you are good and can win each map with the 1 life modifier like I do, it means there is no grind at all in the game. You don't need to re-play any levels, you can just keep going on to the next new map and you will already have enough gear to beat that. If you struggle with maps and are maybe getting less XP from not using any modifiers, and therefore getting fewer upgrades, you might need to re-play a few maps to level up. But in terms of grind this is nothing like some games. Overall this game just seems to be about giving you a fun time. 

There are a decent number of levels, good for the price, and there are many more you can download on Steam Workshop.  Most TD games I just play to completion and then don't go back, there are only a few that I have completed multiple times, and this one of those games.

p.s. Ignore my play hours, I have completed this game multiple times on many devices, I have put a total of about 40 hours into it.

This game is pretty good. Its not too hard and not too difficult. The Design is clear and you both get stronger and get new abilities as you progress in the game by a decent pace. Like most tower defense games the towers and abilites you get are good for diffrent things and on diffrent maps.

If you find that the maps are too easy you also quickly get additional "runes" which are extra harder settings you can add in each map. There is also one rune which changes the map from a set amount of waves with set invaders to an endless one with random waves. Each time you beat a map you get experience. If you beat a map again you only get additional experience if you beat your last record and only by that additional amount. The endless rune has a separate record. This gives increased replayability. Specially since the additional runes can change things a lot.

28917659.review:
Well now that I've beaten all the maps and see the icon for a spike trap whenever I blink. I think I can give a proper summary.


Logos:
All the parts you'd expect in a rational td are here. Leveling towers, upgrade trees, gradual unlocking, ye olde basic dart tower that gets left on the side of the road as better towers are unlocked. Those of you familiar with Gemcraft will find a friendly skeuomorph in the wave bar. Difficulty is controled with a set of runes which will be familiar to those who've played Bastion. There's a novelty here though, as one of the runes makes the round easier in trade for lower XP gain. A brilliant use of the system.

Warfare stands out though by being significantly puzzle baised without being an actual puzzle (generally). Maps tease multiple optimal solutions with only a handful turning out be legitimate. After a few times I had thought I had found a general solution only to have a later map prove me wrong.


Pathos:
While other TD's relish in their direct damage traps Warfare gives significant love to the maligned physics traps. In Orcs Must Die the funnest traps were the ones that sent Orcs flying. Warfare's idea of crowd control is a spring trap into a bottomless pit and it [i]works[/i]. Watching a harpoon trap drag heavy units into magma rarely gets old. While a delight the physics traps are no panacea, levels sometimes lack waste disposal chutes necessitating direct damage. The little blood explosions and pixel gibs help elevate the established spike and dart traps above their peers.


Ethos:
The lightning trap is crap, the slot machine is fun but when one of the result is self-destruct it's limited, the lich crypt while in theory fun takes up one of the 9 slots that could be better spent, calling a new wave always gives the same reward regardless of time left to it, lv4 lightning trap hits air lv3 does not what does and does not hit air is not delineated, dart towers have no utility or reason to use them later on, the lock on how far you can zoom out makes it hurt to look at for long periods on large screens.

28051485.review:
評価：92／100点

寸評：
　・罠を設置して敵を撃退する、2Dタワーディフェンス
　（キャラクターを操作するなどのアクション要素なし）。

　・攻略MAPは通常モードとエンドレスモードとがある。
　　エンドレスモードは一定の条件をクリアすることで
　　開放される（それ程厳しい条件ではない）。

　・MAPをクリアすることで新しい罠やボーナスポイントを獲得
　　できる。ボーナスポイントはレベルアップでも獲得できる。

　・獲得したボーナスポイントで任意の罠やステータス（ライフや
　　MAP開始時のGold）を強化させることが可能。

　・経験値は、MAP攻略の際「前回の成績を上回った」時のみ得られる。
　　そのため、初期MAPのみを繰り返してレベルアップ化することは、
　　原則できない（先のMAPを攻略することで新しい罠を獲得し、
　　前のMAPに戻ってさらに良い成績を収めてレベルアップ、は可能）。


良い点：
　・攻略MAPに応じて最適な罠の組み合わせを考えるのが楽しい。

　・敵の大群（MAPによっては大変に多い）の撃退が気持ちよい。

　・一通りMAPを攻略しても、STEAMワークショップでユーザーの
　　作ったMAPをプレイできる（エンドレスモードを念頭に設計
　　されているMAPも多数）。

　・ユーザーの声に耳を傾ける開発者の姿勢（UIなどの不満に対し、
　　即座にアップデートで対応するなど）。


気になった点：
　・通常モードとエンドレスモードとで、罠の評価が全く異なる
　（通常モードでは非常に有用であるが、エンドレスモードではまるで
　　役に立たないと思しき罠もある）。

　・中断セーブがない。
　　そのため、一度MAPを攻略し始めたら、勝つか負けるかしかない。

　・エンドレスモードは、実質的に有限。
　　敵の体力と歩行スピードが尋常ではなくなるWAVE150以降は、達成が
　　困難（MAPによっては900万点以上のスコアを出せることもあるが、敵を
　　一撃死させる要素（奈落の底等）のないMAPでは、520万点程度出せれば御の字）。


購入を迷っている方へ：
　「SANCTUM」や「ORC MUST DIE」などにあるようなアクション要素を求める場合、
　このゲームは不向きと思われます。

　「DEFENSE GRID」に登場するような敵の大群を火炎放射で燃やし尽くすのが
　お好きな場合、お勧めできます（火炎放射系の罠があります）。

28049714.review:
相当精致的塔防类游戏，不久前还加入了中文支持，对于独立工作室来说难得的良心。
优点：不同于“兽人必须死”系列的第一人称塔防，Dungeon Warfare-“地牢战争”这游戏是上帝视角类塔防，玩家最大的乐趣莫过于设计好陷阱利用地形杀或者陷阱配合，坑杀敌人的成就感！像素风格的血腥死亡动画；敌人的死亡语音的配合让玩家上手的第一时间感觉到“愉悦”。
缺点：中后期的关卡难度把握的不是很到位，部分关卡即使不开符文也对于新人来讲过于艰难，很难一次打通，容易打击玩家积极性，特别是像我这种强迫症患者，不开符文不舒服，结果中后期频频卡关以致累觉不爱了。
心得：一个类似bug的陷阱配合，旋刃陷阱加至少40级的陷阱过载能让旋刃近乎永动机般无限工作，单路大杀器，缺点是不能点“陈锈”以及“纯净”符文。黑洞陷阱在某些地形临近悬崖、熔岩的关卡有妙用。建议新人先通关，后挑战，很多陷阱都需要先通关才会解锁。最重要的一点：不要作死开全符文，量力而行！！！

28030666.review:
TD游戏该有的基本都有了：
地图多、塔种类多、敌人种类多、无穷模式、自定义障碍物、赚经验和宝石来升级、敌人花样死法、可互动的地形诸如此类的~

这款游戏与其他TD比较根本不同的是多了自定义符文系统
这个自定义符文让玩家可以自行控制关卡的难度来挑战自我
这个游戏的大部分时间都是消磨在符文系统上
加入单纯零符文过关的话，大部分关卡其实都很简单
有些关卡如果你挑选的符文不对的话，增加的难度可以说是翻倍的


不过话又说回来了，游戏本身缺点也不是没有
TD游戏比较常见的不同陷阱之间平衡性不好（前期减速陷阱、吹箭陷阱、地刺陷阱可以无脑过很多关了）
后期玩法单调（如果不是为了刷一些成就，这个游戏的游戏时间会更短）
而且自从更新了中文后我反倒时不时遇到一些BUG。。。。


不过最重要的是：
[spoiler]这游戏有膜法陷阱！可以让人变成....而且还有相应的成就，真正的粉丝当然要第一时间拿到这个成就啦！[/spoiler]

27861364.review:
[h1]オススメかそうでないかならオススメ、諸手を挙げてというわけではない[/h1]

もしタワーディフェンスにアクション要素が加わることに抵抗がなく、財布に余裕があるならば、[url=http://store.steampowered.com/sub/18259/]Orcs Must Die!シリーズ[/url]をお勧めしたい。


古典的2Dタワーディフェンス。罠が似通ってるため、私は既プレイのOrcs Must Die!シリーズ(以下OMD!と記す)とどうしても比較してしまうのだが、OMD!と比べてみていくつか不親切と言いたい部分があった。

まず装備強化に使うジェムの入手量が少ない点。OMD!と違い上限なしでトラップを強化できるので仕方ないのかもしれない。だが強化されたトラップは未強化よりも数段強くなるので強化必須に感じるのに対し、ジェムの入手量がしょっぱすぎる。ステージによって使いたいトラップが違っても、強化の振り直しが面倒でいつものトラップで出撃することが多々あった。

[strike]次にUIや操作がスマホゲームから進化していない部分がある点。一つのトラップを並べて設置したい時などはそこそこストレスがたまる。[/strike]

[strike]また敵侵入が始まると、時間が止まるor時間を止めることができないので、ゆっくり考える時間がなくなる点。「ウェーブ内容を熟考して始めろ」ということなのかもしれないが、このゲーム性なら止めれてもよかったのではと思う[/strike](またバリケードを破壊する敵もいるが、なんの警告もなく出現し、バリケードが壊れてから時間が止まるのも「ウェーブ内容を熟考して始めろ」ということなのだろうか)。

最後にフレンドとのスコアアタックができない。せっかく最大取得経験値の記録をつけれるのだから、手軽に見比べれると良かったのだが……


このような不満点は私個人の感想であり、またOMD!よりも安い。何より私自身も面白く遊べたので、どちらかと言えばオススメとします。



-追記-
motonarikazura2 さんより情報をいただきました。ありがとうございます。

一応色々ショートカットが有ります。説明不足過ぎますが。
一時停止はＴＡＢキー、連続設置はシフトを押しながら設置。
しかしそれを知るには操作設定を開かないといけない。
自分も最初はそのあたりにイライラしていましたが、知ってしまうと快適です。

27786850.review:
If you like defense, this game is exactly like Orcs Must Die!, except it's not 3D and it's slightly lower quality graphics, and there's no hero running around.  But otherwise... same game pretty much: kill the adventurers (not orcs) that are running through the dungeon.

Custom user-generated maps are in the workshop.  This is really great, and the community seems pretty active.

There are runes that act as handicaps and provide an XP multiplier (or divider, in case you want the game to be easy).  And the runes are introduced over several levels, which adds a little.  I appreciate the thought that went into the design.

The UI and voice acting, even in the UI, are pretty good and funny with everything detuned down about 3 octaves.  If you enjoy hearing splat and screaming sounds of adventurers falling to their deaths, this game is probably for you.

Some of the levels are insanely difficult.  Spectacular!

27190102.review:
[おすすめ度：★★★★☆]
穴落としTD

　〈基本説明〉
基本的なタワーディフェンスで敵ユニットをポータルまで到達させないようにする
ステージは40以上、トラップ（タワー）の種類は20種類、消費系トラップが8種類
トラップは壁や床に設置し、通路の妨害をできるのは1種類のみ

　〈特徴〉
このTDの大きな特徴はトラップが高コスト、普通の攻撃が得策ではない、ユニットがぶつかり合うこと
・トラップのコストは500程度のものが多いのに対して、1ユニット当たり10前後の報酬がほとんど
　中盤までのゴールド運用がとにかく難しい
・普通に攻撃していっても問題はないが、穴に落としたほうが強い
　ステージによっては穴や溶岩といった場所があり、そこに落とすためのトラップもいくつか用意されている
　敵ユニットにも体重が設定されており、強いユニットは基本的に重い
・ユニットがぶつかり合って思わぬ方向に進みだす
　突然違うルートを通るユニットが出たり、大群のユニットが細い道に詰まって引っかかったりする

　〈感想〉
数時間遊べたら良いなという思いで買ったけど、数十時間やるほどでした
とにかく大量の敵を穴に落としていくのが爽快
どんなに硬い敵も落とせば一撃という儚さ
エンドレスモードで敵を詰まらせていってる状態も見てて面白い

ちょっと奇抜なTDです

26758215.review: What starts out as a simple, yet satisfying tower defense-style game quickly turns into a frantic test of wits and resource management. As the levels get progressively more open and the enemies faster and stronger, you're challenged to find the most efficient way of dispatching the advancing horde. Steam says I've got 20 hours in as of writing this review and there are still towers and enemies I've yet to encounter. Admittedly, I'm crap at the game, but having a ball just the same. If you're a wizard at such games, you also have the option of handicapping yourself with any number of debuffs through the rune system. I have a couple minor gripes. The art style is nice, but the soundtrack is limited - one song during battle, one for the map/leveling screen. These become quite repetitive. Futher, I'd like to be able to pull the camera out futher to be able to see the entire map, though that may be part of the management aspect. I just find it annoying as valuable time is wasted scrolling around. The variety of enemies is vast, and their unique characteristics require a mix of traps as you advance. Further, traps become progressively more expensive, so spamming (for example filling the room with floor spikes) will quickly drain your resources and leave you exposed. The numerous maps coupled with the replay options added through the rune system make it well worth the asking price for anyone who enjoys tower defense style games.

26713250.review:
Успел поиграть в различное множество [b]Tower Defence (TD)[/b] и могу твёрдо сказать, что эта игра, достойный представитель своего жанра.  
  Выступаем в роли тёмного властелина подземелья, к которому из-за всех углов вылезают эти наглые и пронырливые людишки-воришки, которые всячески хотят уничтожить ваше ламповое и милое царство. 
 Единственным недостатком игры является на мой взгляд, плохо прорисованный "пиксель арт", особенно когда на маленькой карте, смешиваются в общую цветную мишуру толпы разных врагов и сложно оперативно реагировать на игровую ситуацию. 
 Во всём остальном игра является классическим примером TD, в 2D измерении, со своей механикой, врагами и башнями, роль которых выполняют изощрённые ловушки. На выходе получаем сносную игру, с приятными особенностями, а именно: 

- Общая сбалансированность, которая заключается в том, что нет перекоса по заработку золота и покупки ловушек, получается золотая середина, когда голды хватает ровно на столько, чтобы вовремя отбивать волны врагов, делать улучшения, достраивать новые баррикады и в режиме импровизации быстро додумывать новые тактические решения. 

- Это действительно сложный TD, ряд миссий проходятся легко, над другой частью приходится поломать голову, местами путём проб и ошибок, а также с помощью подбора вариативности, постепенно находишь правильные варианты прохождения, которые иногда удивляют своими тактическими подходами. Также, в игре предусмотрены руны, которые повышают сложность врагов, а значит, чем больше рун, тем больше шанс, что дальнейшее прохождение будет стремиться к поражению. Также для настоящих хардкорщиков, имеется возможность сыграть в бесконечные волны и тем самым проверить свои силы стратегического мышления. 

- Разнообразие в игре. Например, только игровых не шаблонных уровней представлено в количестве 40+ карт, причём среди них есть довольно интересные, которые заставляют возвращаться к осмысленному перепрохождению в сложных режимах. Самые главные орудия против наших врагов это - разнообразные ловушки, которые также имеют систему прокачки, причём очень хорошо сделано, что получаемые очки распределения навыков можно сбрасывать, а значит можно постоянно играться с их апгрейдами. А это местами необходимо, ведь для конкретного уровня подходят только определённые ловушки и своеобразная тактика. Также уровни можно создавать самому, для этого имеется встроенный в игру редактор карт. 
 Все ловушки имеют свою полезную ценность, для каждой найдётся применения и большинство из них отлично взаимодействуют друг с другом. 

- Есть свобода выбора при расстановке защитных ловушек, ставить их мы можем не в строго упорядоченные ячейки, а имеется широкий диапазон вариантов, как по месторасположению, так и по направлению. 

- Отсутствует кнопка прямой паузы игры. Для кого-то, это может показаться минусом, но в моей системе координат, в любой TD не должно быть таких кнопок, ибо с такой возможностью, полностью не погрузишься в атмосферу игры, не почувствуешь азарт, кураж и не сосредоточишься на её важных деталях. Вместе с тем, в игре присутствует кнопка ускорения, а вот она как раз нужна, чтобы не тратить попусту время, когда волны врагов слабы, продолжительны и отнимают много игрового времени.

- Но самое главное это конечно [b]настоящий ФАН [/b]. В этой игре мы получаем настоящий "Пиксельный Кармагеддон", трэш, мясорубку, фарш в одном флаконе, уничтожая бесконечный поток орды врагов, самыми разнообразными способами: подталкиваем их в лаву, прессуем в шипованные стены, сжигаем напалмом, замораживаем крионом, протыкаем гарпунами и всячески выкидываем в чёрные дыры неизвестности. 
 Если вы давно хотели побывать в роли Злого Тёмного властелина, то это время настало :) 
 
Во общем если вы любите жанр TD. Тогда однозначно стоит ознакомиться с этим добротным середнячком, если не по полному ценнику, то по скидке точно.

26595980.review:
制作精良的像素风塔防游戏 
-------------------------------------------------
拥有多种类型的陷阱（塔）
[list]
[*]直接伤害类
[*]控制类（减速 冰冻 变羊等）
[*]位移类（用于地形杀）
[*]...
[/list]
陷阱可以在战斗中升级进行增强，同时每一局（非无尽模式）每一种陷阱可以提升一个到最高等级，会有附加效果或是极大增强的能力。同时可以被动的升级陷阱，增强其能力，由于宝石（用于被动升级）的限制，选择合适的陷阱进行升级成为玩家需要思考的策略。
同时拥有多种一次性陷阱，用于补漏，增强陷阱，或是其它特殊用途。
-------------------------------------------------
关卡设计优秀，不同的关卡有不同的主题，对应了多种不同的玩法
[list]
[*]使用陷阱直接击杀
[*]利用地形击杀
[*]利用场景击杀（矿车 滚石）
[*]使用路障引导敌人走向
[*]合理使用一次性陷阱
[*]...
[/list]
关卡在美术设计上也十分优秀，十分契合地牢（dungeon）这一主题
-------------------------------------------------
符文（rune）系统可以用来增强敌人（或是削弱自己），同时增加获得的经验，极大增强了游戏的可玩性以及重复挑战的意义

26594841.review: Эта игра как семечки - вроде сел немного пощелкать, а вот они тебя уже взяли в плен, и не отпускают, пока всю пачку не съешь. Серьезно, этот неказистый с виду тауер-дефенс заставляет как следует поднапрячь извилины и раз за разом возвращаться к запоротому уровню изобретая новые способы изнечтожения врагов и пробуя другие ловушки. Здесь нет стандартных тактик, не получится - как во многих других ТД - прокачать пару-тройку любимых башенок и долбить ими до умопомрачения. Это скорее даже головоломка, чем стандартная защита. Вообщем, любителям жанра, которым не будет резать глаз уж очень символическая графика, можно однозначно посоветовать.

③创意工坊
没错，这游戏，有创意工坊！！！   通关后无聊随便找张图玩，又是一条好汉。

总结：各方面都非常棒的游戏，塔防/地牢风爱好者强烈推荐。

游戏名称：地牢战争
于2016年10月29日万圣节打折时购买。

以前早就关注这个游戏了，一直没找到机会入，万圣节的时候打折9块钱入了。游戏容量也很小。
很好玩的一款塔防小游戏，像素画风搭配着劲爆的BGM简直让人中毒！下载以后不知不觉玩了俩小时。很适合没事的时候来一两把爽一爽。
塔防游戏规则大家都懂，我就不多说了。在这里给大家说一下游戏中的特别元素。
随着过关解锁新塔和符文。符文有好有坏，其实不能这么说，我把它称作挑战符文和推关符文大部分是挑战符文：给敌人加成，给你额外的经验值。还有就是推关符文：削弱敌人但会降低你所获得的经验值。推关符文不能于挑战符文一起使用。在开始游戏以前，你有机会选择你要的符文开始游戏，挑战符文可以多选，越多越难[spoiler]TMD有一个符文是让你只能有一个pass！[/spoiler]随之你的经验也越多。
无尽模式不是一开始就有的，需要推关得到无尽符文才可以玩无尽模式。
没错，这游戏有等级系统，升级会提升你每关的初始金币数量，还会给你钻石。钻石可以用来升级你的塔和一些其他物品。[spoiler]你甚至可以升级你的初始生命值和初始金钱。[/spoiler]每升几级会给你一个额外的陷阱格子。所以升级也非常重要。
关卡有很多，有主线有支线还有挑战。杀怪音效听着很过瘾（手动滑稽）地图互动性很强，可以给怪物安排路线。路障炸了游戏会提示你然后就会卡住不动...点啥都没反应。解决方法就是点一下暂停再点回来就好了好像是设计上的一个小失误，不过也无伤大雅。
很魔性的小游戏，值得一试！

随后要提一下
这游戏官方给加入了中文
良心厂商

感谢加入中文！
Thanks for add Chinese language!

26194700.review:
最近のアップデートで日本語に対応したので、簡単にレビューを。
DungeonWarfareの最大の特徴は難易度の上昇とともに、雑魚は雑魚のままでも物量で押し寄せてくる、数の暴力を味わえることにあります。
体力５の農民が１００人押し寄せてくる恐怖。しかし、罠を強化し適切に配置すると、恐怖が一転、快感へと変換されます。
豊富な罠にバランス取りが絶妙なマップで最後まで飽きさせない作り・・・まぁ、まだ最後までクリアできていませんが。

難易度も、ルーンを任意に起動させ「敵の動きを早くする」「敵の体力を増加する」といったように、プレイにペナルティを加える事でより歯ごたえのあるものにできます（ペナルティを増やすとクリア時にもらえる経験値の倍率が上昇）。逆に、難易度を下げたい場合はそれ専用のルーンもありますし、罠のレベルをジェムを使用し強化させることで対応しています（ジェムはステージクリアやレベルアップするともらえます）。

とにかくタワーディフェンスを遊びたい、王道を楽しみたい、プチプチをつぶすような爽快感を味わいたい人には、本作DungeonWarfareはおすすめです。
最後までクリアしたのはkingdomRush（ブラウザ版）のみ。DefenseGrid、OrcsMustDie!、メゾン・ド・魔王と数々のタワーディフェンスゲームに負けてきた私が言うのだから間違いありません！

26062997.review:
The music gets old fast and the game balance is all over the place.

You can't see all the waves at the start so you can't choose an appropriate loadout for half the maps without having played through most of it already and unavoidably lost.

The traps become available as you complete maps yet unlike any other tower defense the availability is almost directly proportional to how far you are through the game.  I got really tired of not having all the tools I wanted for any given map.

Also there's a lot of random chance involved in trap behavior and enemy movement.  Maybe your pusher trap will catch a whole lot of enemies, or maybe it will only push one!  Even if you set things up to clump up enemies the pusher will sometimes just fail to work properly or miss some of the clump.  There's serious reliability issues, which makes the fast-moving enemies that ignore demons (one of the best ways to control enemy movement) MAJOR problems, even if you plan for them.  You basically just have to hope that the setup you have is enough for whatever the level throws at you.

I don't like having to HOPE.  I want to be able to PLAN.

Edit: okay, now you can see what all the units in each wave are by scrolling the waves.  Yet that doesn't solve some of the most irritating problems with this game: MASS UNITS.  The game loves to throw like 50 of one type at you, and if your setup isn't specifically made to deal with that and actually WORKS to deal with that, you're screwed.  There are just too many enemy units that require specific traps to deal with, especially with runes enabled.

25989323.review:
[b]While [i]Dungeon Warfare[/i] may look a little janky from a distance, it's actually one of the best tower defense games I've ever played.[/b] What points it may lose from 'meh' artwork and subpar music/sound effects, it easily gains back with the superb mechanics and near perfect balance. [b]When it comes to the tower defense genre, these devs know exactly what elements to leave in, and which ones we can do without.[/b]

[i]Dungeon Warfare[/i] has the ease-of-access that we experienced with [i]Plants vs. Zombies[/i] yet brings some serious strategy I associate with more 'hardcore' tower defense games such as [i]Defense Grid[/i]. In fact, if you have ever felt that [i]Defense Grid[/i] has a bit too much polish, wayyy too game mode and level options, and could do without the 3D aspect - I strongly urge you to give [i]Dungeon Warfare[/i] a shot.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+While this title does nothing new to push the tower defense genre forward - it gets everything right and makes for a [i]very[/i] satisfying and addicting tower defense game
+Easy cheesy to learn, really difficulty to master
+Tons of replayability and grinding for your ten bucks
+Runs on a toaster (take that [i]DG[/i]!)

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Having one item that respawns based on a timer makes for some tedious OCD clicking, sometimes - I'd be curious how the game plays without that category of item
-Yeah, it came out on mobile recently, so I won't fault it too much, but there is that (and its substantially cheaper there - as always)

[b]If you even remotely enjoy tower defense games, I wouldn't hesitate to pick this up at full price.[/b]

25877790.review:
The metagame of GemCraft, the upgrade system of Kingdom Rush, and the trap selection of Orcs Must Die. I mean that quite literally; elements of those games are shamelessly copy-pasted here, but rather than ending up like a round of "spot the stolen assets in this shovelware Unity game", they're put to excellent use to make one of the most impressive tower defense games yet seen.

It does have some pretty intense difficulty spikes, though. "Heroes Must Die" is where you'll really have to start putting on your thinking cap and abusing the level layouts as much as possible. It's kind of disappointing that the difficulty gradually mandates the pickiest minmaxing possible, and it also seems to drop mouse clicks on occasion which is frustrating when things get frantic. Still an addictive little package, and even comes with a level editor. I sprung for the mobile version too, and it's equally awesome minus the level editor.

This scratches the Tower Defense itch in a big way, and has some basic underlying mechanics in common with the legendary Gemcraft series, but it's really it's own thing. I'm still in the early levels of the game but I wanted to drop a quick review to say, first, this is like a 9/10 game, buy it if you enjoy the TD genre or games in the vein of Dungeon Keeper. And second, I find this game (and Gemcraft games) better paced if you focus on beating the levels that unlock things first, and wait until you've got more to work with before you try activating a bunch of difficulty modifiers - you don't get anything for failing a level unless it's on endless mode, and it's possible on some levels to keep up with most of the level but just not have the capability due to a lack of the correct traps or insufficient gem investment to take out the later waves.

25083800.review: This is a great TD.  Dungeon Warfare allows for path building, changing of weapons arsenal, upgrades, & funny physics when the lil' dudes bite the dust.  Pushing them off the side or springboarding them away is especially enjoyable.  There are a lot of new ideas here, plus old ones done well.  I'm not sure why more people don't own this one.  For me it's up there with Bloons or Gemcraft.  Dungeon Warfare deserves a wider audience.  I am 8 hours in and only 30% through the map or so, and still the game is trhowing different challenges at me.  Some are action based, but nothing insane thus far.  The formulae is core tower defence with tons of creative destruction...  Lots of blood & gibs as well.  STill, the retro style makes it appropriate for a coffee break cool-down with comic violence akin to 16-bit games.  It makes me laugh sometimes at the sheer number of lemming-like soldier marching to their doom in the 100s and 1000s.  <Insert evil boss laugh here>  The antihero element is perhaps too entertaining.  There is far more than $10 worth of fun here.  And I'm not nearly finished yet!  Dungeon Warfare is an overlooked deamon -I mean diamond!- in the rough.  Evil geniuses apply here.

24119451.review:
TL;DR: If you like tower defense games, this is an enjoyable TD with a twist. But it has its problems.

The graphics and music are well done in the 8-bit era style, nothing to complain here.

The gameplay reminded me of Orcs Must Die (or Dungeon Keeper even). You place traps that finish your enemies in various, graphical and delicious ways. In addition to the traps, the levels can have boulders and pits which you can use to your advantage.

However, due to the nature of traps, the game lacks some depth. Why? Well, it all boils down to fact that traps have very limited range of operation AND the path is one-way (i.e enemies just run from start to end). Some traps operate on larger area, but the trigger area is usually quite small, like one tile. This means that the path can actually be considered a single line on which you place the traps, and each trap can only affect one short part of the path. And because different traps benefit from proximity, the most efficient solution is usually a small "death alley" where you grind everything to pulp (or toss/drag the in the pits). 

In many TD games you can use the tower range to your benefit by placing towers in such places that they cover as large area as possible, and areas as early AND as late as possible (to make use of giving your tower more time to work on the enemies). In Dungeon Warfare there is simply no such thing. (Well, there is, but it's more like a special case).

Once you realize this, it eats a bit of the experience. Even the most fancy and complex levels can be solved with concentrating on a small space, effectively ignoring much the level. 

The game does get a bit more complex in the end. And for the record, I haven't completed the game yet, I think I'm at 70% or so.

Some random issues:
* Start of the game was quite heavily tutorialized, but nothing annoying
* Trap tiers and upgrading traps was NOT tutorialized, didn't learn this until later on when wondering what the "tier" means
* Going back to old levels to finish the optional gem levels is a bit stupid as all your upgrades make the game super easy (why not limit traps and/or slots per level?)
* Music is slightly repetitive... I cannot understand why many indie games have such a short soundtrack. Easy way to add value, folks!

Despite all this I'm still enjoying the game quite a bit, and wholeheartedly recommend it. It's just that with some design changes the game could be even better. Maybe for DW2? :)

24021005.review:
A great tower defense game with a huge variety of towers, enemies and possible strategies.

This is a hidden gem of a very good tower defense game, comparable with Defender's Quest and Gemcraft, but ten times less known. What can you expect from the game?

- A huge variety of upgradable towers, unlocked gradually so you can learn about each one
- Respeccable skill points that you can (and must) distribute according to the map you're going to play
- Challenge modes that make the maps more difficult in exchange for better rewards
- An endless mode with ever harder waves 
- User-created maps and a map editor

Most of the fun comes from the well designed towers and traps. In their most basic form, TD games have usually three types of towers - the reliable peashooter, the slow firing group damager and a slowing tower. In Dungeon Warfare you can of course use these basic towers and combine them with traps such as:
- Spikes shooting from the ground
- A harpoon pulling an enemy towards the abyss
- A push trap that pushes whole groups in the direction you wish
- A blackhole that sucks nearby enemies onto a single tile, making them a better target for the following AoE attacks
- A lich that turns any enemy it kills into a zombie fighting on your side
- A rotating spintrap rising from the ground and hacking everyone who comes near into minced meat
- A hex trap that turns an enemy into a frog

There are many effective combinations you can find and there is no set way of finishing a level. For example so far my go-to killzone consists of a chessboard of spintraps and spikes with a blackhole at the beginning and a spring trap at the end. The spintraps and spikes deal most of the damage to groups, blackhole pulls enemies periodically back so they have to travel through the kill zone again and the spring trap throws any straggler back into the fray. Sprinkle with a few liches to further slow down enemies and a gold enhancer and put a grinder at the end for any heavy units that make it through.

Another favourite strategy that some maps support is a using lot of push plates and harpoons combined with a slow trap, disposing of enemies by pushing/pulling them into the abyss. This is especially useful for large groups of slow, heavy enemies. It doesn't however work on thieves and horsemen who are too fast for the push plates and run through. Those must be disposed with a spintrap/flamethrower or spikes. The abyss also doesn't pose danger to flying enemies, those are better killed with a lightning trap and bolts.

All enemies have their weight and pushing/pulling traps have their force, so light enemies will get pushed further/faster than heavy ones, something you have to take into account. You can upgrade your push traps to have more force, but if there is a walkway behind the abyss, light enemies might get pushed too far and land safely on the other side, while if the trap is too weak, heavy knights and golems don't even move. Of course this can also be used to your advantage, as you can create endless cycles forcing groups of light enemies to go through your killzone multiple times...

You get the idea.

Graphically the game looks very simple, but unfortunately the screenshots don't make the game any favor as they look very chaotic. When in motion the game is quite clear and you know what is happening.

Don't let the screenshots dissuade you.

All in all Dungeon Warfare is a very good entry in the TD genre, well worth playing.

As far as tower defenses go, I feel Dungeon Warfare is quite the original. But I also think it's fair to claim this will not be everyones cup of tea. It is cruel! The 10 or 20 first hours or so was a pure drudgery (for me anyway). I think the progression feels slow before you get adjusted to it. You can adapt the difficult settings for more points, so you are never completely blocked but it's way too easy to bite off more then you can chew, you get stomped and in turn this makes many levels feel very intimidating. Unlocking new levels felt like a punishment Instead of a reward. 

But it grew on me, and especially after unlocking all towers and getting to run the whole thing over again to beat every map with 6 runes (the last achievment) it all turned out to be very satisfying. And I truly believe this is one of the better tower defense games out there. 

Lengthy, challenging, and with a plethora of strategies to try out. 


Some of the bad stuff (that I think should be fixed):
* Leaving a map and trying to find the same map in the "mystery meat" navigation of 40+ levels is retarded to say the least. Maybe highlight last played map?
* Or better yet: fix the real problem, allow respeccing your skill points when in a map, so you don't have to leave it to change a tower or skill point.
* I find the "tower styles" that indicate with how many runes you have completed a map is ambiguous at best. I want numbers, or stars, or pretty little diagrams with ponys and rainbows...


Anyway, great game.

21883711.review:
+ Runes (difficulty settings for increased exp bonus) are all available at the start, so seasoned TD players can instantly start the game at a suitable difficulty level.
+Towers are reasonably well balanced. Generally towers work well when used in combination with others, e.g. a choke point with a spike trap and demons to prevent enemy movement.
+ Simple physics system with numerous towers that take advantage of it, e.g. harpoon trap pulls enemies towards it and potentially into a pit, spring traps can launch enemies to another part of the maze, etc.
- The retro graphics style, while not bad, does make it unclear at times what's happening. It's at times impossible to mouse-over a specific entity for more info.
- No zoom function. Not a massive problem, but it would have been a nice addition.
- All units seemingly share the same soundset - golems that fall to their deaths will use the same scream as a peasant.
- Consumable trap feature (basically the "spell" slot) - while it's not a bad thing, I would have liked to see this as an optional feature. The way I like to play TDs is to do all the planning (building of towers) and then just watch the carnage without having to micro-manage the battle using spells. The game is balanced around using these, so simply not using them is not an ideal decision. I recommend adding a rune that disables the consumable trap slot entirely, maybe for something like 1.2-1.35x exp gain.

Recommended if you enjoyed Kingdom Rush, Gemcraft TD or Orcs Must Die. This game is on par with those, if not better.

Easily the best tower defense in over a year.

このゲームの大きな個性は2つ
ひとつは敵の多さ。あまりに敵が多すぎてまれに集団が「液体」に見えるほど。多けりゃいいってもんなんです、大量の敵を捌ききるのはそれはもう爽快で他のTDにはない感覚がある。

もう一つはバランスの良さ。種類が豊富なのに無駄なタワーが一つとしてなくステージの形や敵の種類によってかならず最適解になる場面が訪れるのがすごい。

マップエディットやワークショップとの連動もできる。難易度も自由度が高く制限をかければ経験値が増える、不慣れな人でも一通りのクリアは楽しく迎えられるし制限をかけて地獄を見ることもできるのでマップ数の割にボリュームはかなりある。集団をさばく爽快感があるので飽きにくい

悪く言えば無難で冒険した個性的なシステムなどはないもののかゆいところには必ず手が届く形になっていて普通のことのようで他のタワーディフェンスではまずこうはいかない。高水準にまとまってる爽快TDゲー、おすすめ。

The concept of being an evil ruler of a dungeon has been tinkered with before. And although I haven't found the game where you are constantly upgrading your dungeon and expanding it. All the traps are fun and unique, all the reusable powers are better for each level. Lots of replayability with Endless mode on every map. I don't think there were too many actual flaws with this game at all, I did have a couple of glitches on the final boss. But the battle was so fun I didn't mind playing it 3 times. 21151962.review:
Dungeon Warfare é o exemplo mais forte de um Tower Defense praticamente perfeito e o motivo eu vou explicar ao longo desta análise. 

Dungeon Warfare foi produzido pela Valsar que até então eu desconhecia seu trabalho no desenvolvimento de games. Um belo dia entrei na steam e filtrei por "Tower Defense" para achar algum jogo interessante deste gênero que me agrada mas que muitos dos títulos ou são completamente baseados em grind ou port de mobile que muitas vezes vem com aquele sistema que apesar de não ser Pay to Win é baseado em grind a todo instante, foi ai que achei Dungeon Warfare e meus amigos, que grata surpresa!

Dungeon Warfare funciona da seguinte maneira: Você apenas coloca armadilhas dos mais variados tipos para impedir que os inimigos cheguem ao núcleo do jogo (sua base) e destrua ela por completo. Simples não é verdade? 

No jogo o jogador vai ter várias opções de armadilhas, várias missões e o melhor: A possibilidade de aumentar a dificuldade ou diminuir a dificuldade atraves de Runas, ou seja. Quer aumentar a dificuldade da partida? coloque runas que vão aumentar o poder dos inimigos ou até mesmo tirar algumas vantagens do seu jogo. Ou melhor, quer facilitar o jogo por que está achando demasiado complicado? também tem runas para isso. É só usar da maneira que quiser e ser feliz.

Isso funciona de maneira espetacular já que por este motivo o jogo não se torna um exercício de GRIND como diversos jogos do gênero aqui da Steam, ele funciona perfeitamente para jogadores casuais e hardcores, sem grind e sem frustrações.

Lembrando que colocando mais runas e deixando o jogo mais complicado, você ganha mais XP e consequentemente evolui mais rápido, assim ganhando pontos e aumentando os poderes de suas armadilhas e outras coisas.

Dungeon Warfare possui o gráfico estilo pixelado que pode afastar alguns jogadores que não gostam deste estilo gráfico. Da minha parte não é um ponto negativo já que eu amo jogos com este estilo gráfico, além de que o jogo fica super leve e podendo rodar em qualquer computador. Sem contar que as missões são todas bem feitas e bonitas, nada a reclamar.

A trilha sonora combina perfeitamente com a temática do jogo, nada a destacar mas também nada a reclamar sobre a mesma.

A duração do jogo deve ser por volta de 15 - 20 horas pelo que eu vi em algumas análises aqui na Steam, mas voltarei futuramente para comentar sobre a duração do jogo. 

O game ainda possui conquistas + cartas e é praticamente livre de bugs.

Dungeon Warfare é o típico jogo Tower Defense que se destaca por não apelar para grind ou ser um port tosco de plataforma mobile. Ele é diferente, seus gráficos são bonitos e estilizados, a trilha sonora combina perfeitamente com o tema do jogo e oferece uma dificuldade maleável para todo e qualquer tipo de jogador.

É um "Must Buy" para qualquer fã de Tower Defense, que ainda procura uma temática mais voltada para o RPG.

Recomendo!

1) Stay away
2) Not Recommended
3) Only recommended when on sale
4) Recommended
5) [u][b]Highly recommended[/b][/u]
6) This is a must play

21126023.review:
장점
1. 지형지물과 맵의 기믹 활용이 훌륭합니다
2. 장애물(바리게이트)를 이용해 몬스터의 동선을 제약하는 것이 재미있습니다.
3. 아기자기한 도트그래픽이 매력적이고 게임연출의 센스가 전반적으로 좋습니다.

단점
장애물(바리게이트)이 지나치게 쉽게 부서집니다.
장애물을 설치해서 몬스터의 동선을 제약할 수 있는 타워 디펜스 중에서는 가장 쉽게 장애물이 부서집니다. 장애물의 가격도 이런 방식의 디펜스치고는 굉장히 비싼데 수리하기가 매우 번거롭습니다. 저는 '디펜더스 퀘스트'처럼 타워에 내구력이 존재하는 디펜스를 할때에도 타워가 부서지는 것 때문에 스트레스를 받아본 적이 없는데, 던전워페어는 장애물을 일일히 수리하는게 너무 번거롭습니다.  드워프는 장애물에 접근하기 전에 제거하면 되니 괜찮은데, 막을 길이 없는 폭탄 수레가 정말 짜증납니다.

최적화된 방어진을 구축한 뒤 느긋하게 웨이브를 지켜보는 것을 즐기는 분들께는 던전 워페어를 추천해드릴 수 없습니다.



총평
색다른 감각과 깊은 내공이 느껴지는 명작 디펜스. 디펜스 매니아라면 구매해도 후회는 없을 것입니다. 그런데 웨이브 진행 중에 실시간으로 이것저것 컨트롤 해야 하는 것을 귀찮아 하시는 분들이라면 약간 취향에 맞지 않을 수도 있습니다

20957074.review:
Dungeon Warfare is already a great indie tower defense game, much better than more well known titles, and the developers are actively supporting it right from the start.

I'm a huge tower defense fan, and I took a chance randomly buying this on an impulse that it might be something special. Indeed, within 10 hours of gameplay it entered my top 3 all time favourites of the genre. It's basically Dungeon Keeper (you are the evil dungeon master and you slay waves of "good" adventurers) mixed with Orcs Must Die (the violence and the general tower defense ideas) but without any hero micromanagement. Of course this is all presented with bland retro-style pixel graphics but who cares? Functional visuals in a great game is fine with me.

All in all I approve of this formula. I love Orcs Must Die (and Dungeon Keeper for that matter) but the action/hero aspect of Orcs Must Die was always my least favourite part of the game. I prefer more strategy and less action. Maximum violence certainly, but strategic violence, and this game delivers strategic violence by the bucketload. Here's hoping these developers keep developing this dandy little tower defense gem.

かゆいところに手の届きまくった、タワーディフェンスの集大成とも言える作品。

タワーは固定配置型でありながら、バリケードを作って自由に敵の進路を変える事もできる自由度の高さ。
敵を穴に突き落としたり、串刺しにしたり、燃やしたり凍らしたり、ブラックホールで吸い込んだりと、バリエーションの多いトラップの数々。
マップごとにどのトラップメインでいくか、あれこれと考えるのが楽しい。

トラップはジェムを費やす事によって強化する事ができる。強化するとトラップ自体が強くなるだけでなく、
トラップ自体をアップグレードできるようになる（最初はこのことに気づかずレベル1のままやっていた）
特定のトラップを際立たせて、いかに効率的に多くの敵を排除できるかが問われる。

マップ開始前に難易度を底上げしたり、ジェムを毎回リセットして振り分け直したり、マップエディタがあったり、タワーディフェンスシミュレーター的な一面もある。

欠点は、トラップのレベルが小刻みで違いが体感できなかったり、敵が大量にやってくる事で、タワーディフェンスのパズル的な要素がアバウトになっている点。

とは言え、ゲームとしては相当調整されているだろうというのがひしひしと伝わってくる絶妙なバランス。
爽快感もあるので、多くのゲーマーに勧めたい。

20304404.review:
There are many tower defense games available on Steam. In my opinion only some of them are really good. Dungeon Warfare belongs to this group. Although it uses simple pixel graphics the game is very addictive and offers a wide range of options when it comes to setting up your defense grid and define your play style. 

The game features a balanced but very divergent choice of traps and weapons.
Enemies offer interesting and challenging abilities and remain fair except for a few last waves in a few levels.

The game also offers some rpg elements. By beating levels you will earn diamonds that can be used to upgrade weapons and traps. Upgrades can be changed for different levels or different play styles. Twelve runes can be individually activated or deactivated for each level to make the game harder and earn more diamonds.

The game also comes with a simple to use level editor and a Steam workshop that offers levels from other players. Designing individual maps is simple.

If you like tower defense games don't pass on this one. It's great!

20136194.review:
I picked this up on a whim since it appealed to my love of both tower defense and pixel art and discovered an awesome gem of the genre! I'm now at 100% achievement progress!

Dungeon Warfare may not do anything revolutionary or groundbreaking as far as the genre goes, but that's not what I'm looking for... for a genre with seemingly simple paradigms for mechanics and gameplay... I've sadly come across too many otherwise enjoyable games ruined by poor execution of some facet of the experience (usually by trying to be what they're not). Sometimes, I just want to play a pureblooded tower defense; build some towers and watch the enemies get burned, impaled, shocked, or thrown to their doom, without other genres muddying the waters. This game provides exactly that.

What makes this game so good is it boils down the essence of the tower defense experience and everything it does is well executed and enjoyable. Tower defense done right. And because of that, I've had the most fun with a tower defense game that I've had in quite some time!

TL;DR highly recommended for any fan of tower defense!

-- pros/cons --

+ difficulty curve almost perfect (only a couple spots required persistence to progress past)
+ satisfying tower combinations
+ solid progression system
+ little to no grinding to progress
+ great pixel art
+ all traps can have purpose depending on playstyle
+ maps provide ways to use their inherent dangers to your advantage (mine carts, pits)
+ traps both for the ground and walls so pathway space isn't wasted

- minor UI/UX annoyances
- only one tier 4 upgrade of each trap type made my OCD go wild
- would have preferred chiptunes for soundtrack

hats off to the developers, thank you for such a great game!

This game proves that Tower Defenses still have a lot of potential.
Thanks to its top-down view, the game can rely heavily on traps and pits and it changes everything.
You can push enemies into the pits with moving walls, or fire hook arrows to pull them into the abyss.
The game also let you create small packs of auto managed soldiers, to stop the enemies... except some of them who will run faster to get killed by the next trap you put on their way.

Some traps can feel less useful than the others, but once you have tested them enough, you can find them good uses.

On the downsize, it's just a "level after level" kind of game, and if you are stuck on a level (generally because you want to use a strategy which is not the best), you can be blocked a long time.
I highly recommend to watch youtube videos to discover new strategies, even for levels you already completed, because you can play levels a lot of different ways.

The game looks to be between 20 and 30 hours long, and if it's you are an experienced Tower Defense player.
If you have played over 100 Tower Defenses (like me) and think you know everything about the genre, you will still be amazed by how many new stuff this game contains.

19071048.review:
I seriously can't imagine why so few people know about this game.

This game has everything you could want from a Tower Defense game and it may very well be the most strategical one I ever played. A lot of TD games are either too easy or too hard but this game just gets it right: 

Most of the levels are easily winnable on the first try, which is a good thing because of the "rune" mechanic. Runes allow you to customize the difficulty in a really big way, making even the easiest levels challenging if you include all 10 of the difficulty-increasing ones. There is, however also one that allows you to play "endless" mode and another one that significantly decreases the difficulty at the cost of the experience you gain from it, which I find really helpful for players that get frustrated when playing the same level over and over without success. This makes for a perfect difficulty progression.

Another important aspect that really sets this apart from most other TD games is that the variety of towers - or rather:  traps - is remarkable as there are traps that push enemies, traps that pull enemies, traps that spawn minions to stall enemies, AOE traps, traps that counter fast enemies and so on.... This makes for very strategic gameplay because you need to have a good trap composition to counter every type of enemy that comes within a certain level.

As if it didn't have enough replayability already, this game has a built-in easy-to-use level editor and there are already a lot of user-created maps on the workshop. This is pretty cool but I haven't used it a lot as of the time I write this review (7-8 hours in).

My only real complaint previously was the lack of key rebinding options but that was fixed soon after I posted this review initially.

19040778.review:
Tower defense veteran here. Dungeon Warfare plays out similarly to a 2d version of Orcs Must Die, without a controllable hero. The scoring is also calculated in the same manner - Enemies have a score value and that value is multiplied by the # of different traps involved in their demise. You earn bonus points and gold for killstreaks.

There is a rune system (similar to the trait system used in GemCraft games) for added challenge that adds a multiplier to your level score. If you beat a stage, the resulting score is given to you in EXP, which allows you to level up, which gives you increased skill points, starting gold, and trap slots (up to 9). You cannot repeatedly farm a stage for EXP, as only increases in your highest score will net more EXP. Every level also has an endless mode, which is unlocked if you  complete the stage with 4 or more runes. Endless mode is a great way to earn extra EXP, as your score for it is separate from your normal high score. There is also an individually selectable rune to make the game easier, for those who want to progress without as much challenge, but you will earn less points.

Difficulty is fairly well balanced. Most of the early stages are a breeze, but later ones will keep even good players up to devise better strategies. There are also interesting achievements to seek out if you are inclined.

Graphics are gritty, fitting the theme. The game has a dark, medieval steampunk look. Nothing looks impressive or detailed.

The music is redundant. I found it to also fit the theme, but there weren't many tracks. Sounds are limited, but great - especially when units fall into pits.

Enemy variety is important for TD games and there is plenty in this one. There are some that will annoy you, like the horse or dwarf. It's good for a tower defense game to have threatening enemies. Trap (tower) variety is great. There are plenty of interactive cooldown traps to keep you busy.

There is also a map maker included. You can create and play content made by others.

Since music and graphics are the only arguable weak-points, and those matter least to the tower defense genre, I can say that this is one of the best tower defense games released this year. I didn't encounter a single bug throughout my time with this game. It's well-done.

Simple
Uses mechanics a lot of TD games don't bother with like pushing and hooking

Cons:
